titlestmt.titleproper: Cleveland Morris papers related to the Delaware Theatre Company 1982-1998
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Cleveland Morris papers related to the Delaware Theatre Company
did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: Cleveland Morris is the former artistic director of the Delaware Theatre Company, he Brandywine Valley's only resident professional theater company. He helped found the Company, in Wilmington, Delaware, in 1978, and served as its artistic director until his retirement in the summer of 1998.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the personal and administrative files of Cleveland Morris, primarily related to his work as artistic director for the Delaware Theatre Company. The papers include Delaware Theatre Company minutes, agenda, budgets, photocopied clippings, annual meeting reports, financial statements, committee reports, notebooks for individual shows, scripts, correspondence, posters, playbills, pamphlets, and material related to the Educators' Workshop.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An online finding aid is available at http://www.lib.udel.edu/ud/spec/findaids/morrisc.htm.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: University of Delaware: Delaware Theatre Company records.
NOTE: Now a Series in Delaware Theatre Company records (MSS 0633)
